content.body: I made a bot for rendering better (i.e., linkable) logs for matrix channels, for tc39's use. if ya'll would like I can have it do this channel too. currently logs are at https://bakkot.github.io/matrix-logs/, or you can run it yourself from https://github.com/bakkot/matrix-archive-bot
logs are going to be a bit behind because I'm not bothering to have it monitor continuously

For anybody here interested in helping improve content at MDN, https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/5523 is maybe a good first issue that would probably take only 30 minutes or so of work

The work would be writing some additional text that elaborates on the following statement:
> Setting the value of `location.href` _navigates_ to the provided URL. If you want _redirection_, use `location.replace()`
content.formatted_body:
The work would be writing some additional text that elaborates on the following statement:

Setting the value of location.href navigates to the provided URL. If you want redirection, use location.replace()

> <@annevk:mozilla.org> lpd: per spec I think Chrome is wrong and I don't think there's an issue on changing this

Hi, a new day and a fresh set of eyes, I noticed what I was looking for yesterday staring me right in the face: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#focus-fixup-rule. Would you agree the correct behaviour is actually the other way around to what we discussed yesterday?
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @annevk:mozilla.org
lpd: per spec I think Chrome is wrong and I don't think there's an issue on changing this
Hi, a new day and a fresh set of eyes, I noticed what I was looking for yesterday staring me right in the face: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#focus-fixup-rule. Would you agree the correct behaviour is actually the other way around to what we discussed yesterday?

content.body: The language "removed from that Document in some way" seems pretty weird to me, but the examples are clear.
* The language "removed from that Document in some way" seems pretty weird to me, but the examples are clear in my novice reading.

m.new_content.body: The language "removed from that Document in some way" seems pretty weird to me, but the examples are clear in my novice reading.

content.body: lpd: none of the examples are about rendering though, but that is indeed extremely ambiguous; it likely wouldn't pass review if written today
content.formatted_body: lpd: none of the examples are about rendering though, but that is indeed extremely ambiguous; it likely wouldn't pass review if written today

content.body: annevk: In the main text, I believe it's covered by "it stops being a focusable area", since for an input element to be a focusable area it must meet "the element is either being rendered or being used as relevant canvas fallback content."
content.formatted_body: annevk: In the main text, I believe it's covered by "it stops being a focusable area", since for an input element to be a focusable area it must meet "the element is either being rendered or being used as relevant canvas fallback content."

content.body: I guess focusable area is defined in terms of being rendered, yeah
The example box specifically mentions the `hidden` attribute, but I'm not sure if those are normative?
content.formatted_body: The example box specifically mentions the hidden attribute, but I'm not sure if those are normative?

content.body: However, it doesn't seem to invoke an algorithm to change the focused area, meaning no events would dispatch and such and it's a bit unclear what state would change
Examples are non-normative, but they're also not supposed to be wrong :-)
lpd: I guess at this point I'd lean towards an issue against whatwg/html though
content.formatted_body: lpd: I guess at this point I'd lean towards an issue against whatwg/html though

content.body: wonders if there is one already
